article_text: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Reagan ended a 10-day California vacation Sunday, returning to work on a renewed campaign against international terrorism in the wake of another wave of atucks aimed at Americans. While stopping short of blaming Libyan leader Moammar Khadafy for two attacks last week in which Americans were killed, an administration ofTicial accused Khadafy of sponsoring “a master plan ... to cause terrorist inddenls worldwide.’’ Reagan, who spent a working vacation at his mountaintop ranch near Santa Barbara doing chores and horseback riding, was briefed on the explosions on a TWA airliner approaching Athens and in a West Berlin discotheque popular among U.S. soldiers.
